channel.title: Hmmm...this is a problem

item.title: Hmmm...this is a problem
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

heres an idea, void the entire thing you just added (put it in a void) then add the void in its place, code too large means theres too many lines for parseincomingpackets to read, but if you void it, it only reads one line, yet performs the same function. I had the same problem, this fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hmmm...this is a problem
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

Gets code too large
means theres way to much crap in the parseincomingpackets redirect things to voids alike: in parseincoming put this: thisisneeded(); then make a "public void thisisneeded() {" then in that void put your codes.

remember that a void can only hold an amount of 62 - 64 kb (it’s one of both)

Read full topic

item.title: Hmmm...this is a problem
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

I’m tired, so I’m gonna make this quick and hopefully you understand it.

else if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch { if(playerLevel[6] >= 55) { alchvaluez = (alchvaluez / 3); deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1); addItem(995, alchvaluez); addSkillXP((65*playerLevel[6]), 6); startAnimation(712); playerGfx(113, 0); newAnimDelay = 6; newAnim = 712; newAnimRequired = true; } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55) { sendMessage("You need at least 55 Magic to cast High Level Alchemy"); } }
Gets code too large

[code]public void parseIncomingPackets() {
int i;
int junk;
int junk2;
int junk3;

	switch(packetType) {[/code]

When you’re logged in the runserver gives this error for everyone once a second or 2

Unhandled Packet [0. InterFaceID: 7909, size=0]: ][ Action Button: 0

Sometimes the Packet is [0
Sometimes it’s [202
it’s about every 7 or 8 times(also measurable in seconds) it changes for 1 error.
